alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 5:32AM CDT until July 13 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Sumter. * WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in some locations across Sumter County. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Livingston, York, Cuba, Gainesville, Epes, Emelle, The University Of West Alabama, Bluffport, Boyd, Coatopa, Dug Hill, Kinterbish, Geiger, Old Mallard Airport, Lilita, Bellamy, Payneville, Sumterville, Ward and Whitfield.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
